its utmost to help and elevate the Indian population, who have been cast upon our care, and we will have peace, progress, and concord among them in the North-West ; and instead of the Indian melting away, as one of them in older Canada, tersely put it, “as snow before the sun,” we will see our Indian popu- lation, loyal subjects of the Crown, happy, prosperous and self- sustaining, and Canada will be enabled to feel, that in a truly patriotic spirit, our country has done its duty by the red men of the North-West, and thereby to herself.
